poem:
**Political Shifts**  

In whispers of ballots, the tides,  
Reform surges north, where shadows  
hold tight. Southward, Liberals dance,  
filling pockets with orange light.  
Badenoch's sigh weaves through  
council halls, a tapestry of  
lament and change—no simple  
answers in the quivering  
maps of power, painted anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Badenoch apologises for local election results as Reform warned there are ‘no simple answers’ – UK politics live 12.46pm BST As the Tories faced the Reform surge in the north and parts of the midlands, the Liberal Democrats put the squeeze on their vote further south, gaining more than 100 councillors, PA reports. The Lib Dems gained 163 councillors across the 23 councils in this election. “If you’re appalled by lurch to the right by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
